title: Is Don’t Leave Me considered J-pop since it’s in Japanese? - Quora

response.answer_text: Mainly Korean artist songs that get translated into Japanese would not be classified as Jpop songs. Since Jpop has a very different sound and layout to how KPOP is displayed within the industry. Even though its a song made for BTS’s Japanaese fanbase the song style itself is more familiar to KPOP rather than JPOP. An example of a song done by Korean artists for there Japanese audience that would be classed as JPOP would be I*Zones songs Vampire, Suki To Iwasetai and Buenos Aires.
